reporter_caption.center: THE PACIFIC TELE. TELE. CO. v. COUNTY OF LOS ANGELES, 212 Cal. 787 (1931)

caption.center: THE PACIFIC TELEPHONE AND TELEGRAPH COMPANY (a Corporation), Respondent,
v. COUNTY OF LOS ANGELES, Appellant.

opinion.posture: APPEAL from a judgment of the Superior Court of Los Angeles County. Leon R. Yankwich, Judge. Reversed.
opinion.attorneys:
Everett W. Mattoon, County Counsel, and W. Sumner Holbrook, Jr., Deputy County Counsel, for Appellant.
Pillsbury, Madison Sutro and Lawler Degnan for Respondent.
opinion.opinion_text:
THE COURT.
This is one of the cases consolidated on appeal with SouthernCalifornia Telephone Co. v. County of Los Angeles (L.A. No. 10625), ante, p. 121 [298 P. 9], the opinion in which was this day filed. [1] On the authority of that decision, the judgment is reversed.
